metadata.synopsis: This dialog plays at the start of the Ketheric boss fight in the Colony. There are numerous permutations here: Nightsong being dead or alive, freed from her soul cage (through stealth before being spotted); Isobel being absent or tadpoled or tadpoled and killed (in the boss chamber) before entering the dialog; Jaheira being present here (and spotted) or being absent.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play first and set up some important stuff. After this, the dialog may start in several ways: 1 - get spotted by the (neutral) enemies in the boss chamber; 2 - start combat with anyone in Ketheric's combat group; 3 - free Nightsong from her cage (this should pull you into combat with her). Before triggering the dialog, the player might kill Isobel from stealth or destroy Nightsong's cage.Use the debug commands mentioned in the Act2_COL_KethericShowdown goal.

4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
4.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

31.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
31.text: You. After all you've done, after all your trifling, you dare strike at my daughter?!

64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
64.text: What a fool you are. I am death. She is mine. She will return - always return. And you...

51.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
51.text: You. After all you've done, after all your trifling, you dare strike at my daughter?!

71.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
71.text: There you are. As predicted. What is it, I wonder, that draws one toward death like a moth to light?

44.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
44.text: You could have run away. Absconded with the Prism - the one thing that could prevent me from fulfilling my destiny.

76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
76.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
3.text: Perhaps you hoped to learn your place in history before you are erased from it. A bright flash of clarity before the snuffing-out.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I just want to be free of my parasite.

30.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
30.text: Impossible - you are bound to it, and in death it will bind you to me.

72.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
72.text: That is the power my Lord Myrkul has granted me - command over the immeasurable legions of the dead.

16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
16.text: But he did not only give me power - he gave me the one thing no other god could grant me.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I'm here to snuff out this whole evil plot - and you along with it.

28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
28.text: Finer champions than you have tried and failed. But perhaps they lacked the fear that drives you: your freedom, hanging in the balance.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I will find out who I was, and end my killing fate.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: And what is my place, Ketheric?

74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
74.text: Your place is to die so I might finally live.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Why is the Prism so important to you?

26.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
26.text: The very fact of your being attests to its power - despite your infection, you resisted the brain, here in the heart of its domain.

21.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
21.text: What good is an army of thralls if they do not obey their master?

48.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
48.text: My Lord Myrkul gave me the one thing I desired - the one thing that no other god could grant me.

57.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
57.text: My daughter's life returned. Her heart beating once more.

13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
13.text: For that, he asked that I serve as his Chosen, join Orin and Gortash to grow the cult of the Absolute, and then... take control of it.

27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
27.text: He's never had a more devoted follower.

0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
0.text: I have fought great wars before, in the service of other gods, and other powers. But for Myrkul, I would condemn all of Faerûn to death.

78.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
78.text: You are all that stands between me and my destiny - and you have brought the Prism here.

56.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
56.text: I will kill you now. And then I will raise you as my servant.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

29.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
29.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

20.speaker: Isobel
20.text: I'm grateful to you for bringing me home. I was a fool to resist. I know better now.
20.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

11.speaker: Isobel
11.text: Good luck in the City of Judgement. I wish you the best, sincerely.
11.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

70.speaker: Nightsong
70.text: Isobel - my love, what has happened to you?
70.context: NodeContext: Seeing isobel for the first time - shock and surprise, and horror that she's been tadpoled

53.speaker: Isobel
53.context: NodeContext: Seeing Nightsong for the first time. Normally she'd be overcome, btu the tadpole is making her cold

19.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
19.text: My Lord, I offer you these souls so they may return as servants to your cause.

23.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
23.text: Join the army of the dead, True Soul. Witness Lord Myrkul's glory!

1.speaker: Nightsong
1.text: You are no True Soul - you are a champion. Kill the madman. I fight at your side.

84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
84.text: Join the army of the dead, True Soul. Witness Lord Myrkul's glory!

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I was ready to show you mercy before. It's still not too late. You can repent.

38.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
38.text: Repent? Would that even be possible?

33.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
33.text: Repent? Would that even be possible?

24.text: For a moment - a moment only - I was weak. No longer.

66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
66.text: For a moment - a moment only - I was weak. No longer.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You are planning on betraying your allies?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: My place is at the Lord of Bones' side, like yours.

39.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
39.text: All mortals find their place at our Lord's side in time - your time is now.

62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
62.text: I will continue to serve him on this plane as long as I am needed, for he has given me everything I want.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You have an alliance with the Black Hand, Bane. I am his servant. You ought to work with me.

54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
54.text: A temptation or a threat? With your god, it's always the latter, isn't it?

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I will reach my own crimson castle, and your corpse will pave my path.

85.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
85.text: A mad dog like Orin might be impressed. I am not.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I know my destiny - he's waiting in Baldur's Gate. And you're standing in my way, old man.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I am not intimidated by the likes of you. I will gain my queen's favour and ascend.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: The liberation of my people may be close at hand. And I will stop at nothing to see it done.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: My place is in Baldur's Gate. Yours is in a grave - permanently, this time.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Funny you say that. My place is right here, and my 'bright flash' could be the last thing you see...

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Damned wretch. I will liberate my father from your rotten hands.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Neither you nor your pal Gortash know the first thing about my 'place'.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I am right where I need to be - ready to vanquish you and your curse, forever.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I sense you ask questions only to hear yourself answer them - so by all means, tell me my place.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: My place is standing over you, with my boot on your throat.

86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
86.text: But the lure of one's destiny is irresistible, isn't it?

79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
79.text: You - what in the name of the Nine Hells are you doing here?!
79.context: NodeContext: surprised to see us, we should be dead already

43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
43.text: Balthazar - I should have expected his weakness.

83.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
83.text: You - what in the name of the Nine Hells are you doing here?!
83.context: NodeContext: surprised to see us, we should be dead already
